title: New Covid-19 rules in force in Northern Ireland
description: Arlene Foster says they are "extraordinary powers" but that we are living in "extraordinary times".

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe prison leave extended
description: The British-Iranian mother jailed in Tehran is also being considered for clemency, her husband says.

title: Coronavirus: Testing rolled out for frontline NHS staff
description: Hundreds of coronavirus tests will take place this weekend, as infections in the UK continue to rise.

title: FA wants to complete WSL season by August
description: The Football Association remains determined to complete the Women's Super League season - but wants it finished by early August.

title: Draft in Irish military to enforce coronavirus measures - McGregor
description: Former UFC champion Conor McGregor wants the Irish military to support the police and ensure the public complies with coronavirus measures.

title: Greg Rutherford's kids interrupt his workout advice
description: Greg Rutherford's children interrupt his appearance on BBC Breakfast as the Olympic gold medallist is talking about how to keep active during the coronavirus crisis.

title: Coronavirus cradle Wuhan partly reopens after lockdown
description: People enter the Chinese city where the coronavirus outbreak began for the first time in months.

title: Coronavirus: Cruise ship in race to transfer passengers off Panama coast
description: A vessel carrying more than 1,800 people off Panama is moving healthy passengers to a sister ship.

title: Coronavirus: UK wary of international market for ventilators
description: The UK is avoiding buying from middlemen as prices rocket amid feverish global trading conditions.

title: Coronavirus: Deserted London landmarks seen from above
description: Some of the city's most popular landmarks are devoid of the usual crowds as people stay indoors to help combat coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Social distancing gig on a houseboat
description: A community of houseboat owners in Bristol find a unique way to come together during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: 'I've signed up to be an NHS volunteer'
description: England captain Heather Knight talks about volunteering for the NHS, team quizzes and no longer being a fair-weather cyclist during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Acts of kindness and ways people are spreading cheer
description: As countries across the globe take emergency measures to try to tackle the coronavirus, times are pretty tough for many. But lots of people are coming up with amazing ways to cheer each other up. Here are some of the best so far.

title: BBC Sport's five things to do today
description: Our team give you something to read, watch, try, listen and take on - all in one place.

title: ‘My dream home hangs in the balance’
description: Government advice to "postpone a move if at all possible" amid the coronavirus outbreak has left many plans in flux.

title: The Papers: Virus 'strikes at heart of government'
description: The news that the prime minister has tested positive for coronavirus features on the front pages.

title: Coronavirus: Trump signs into law largest bailout in US history
description: The $2 trillion boost is the largest ever as virus cases continue to rise, hitting the economy.

title: Coronavirus: The fake Bill Gates post and other claims to ignore
description: Here are the latest examples of coronavirus disinformation.

title: Coronavirus: From clapping to kindness, five reasons to be hopeful
description: As coronavirus continues to spread, the worst of the crisis has brought out of the best in humanity.

title: The 'Aids quilt' that showed the scale of suffering
description: In 1985, LGBT activist Cleve Jones came up with a creative idea to spotlight Aids deaths in the US.

title: Coronavirus lockdown: Clubbers go online for music
description: With the coronavirus lockdown bringing normal nightlife to an end, some enterprising DJs are going online.

title: Week in pictures: 21-27 March 2020
description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: How the UK’s coronavirus epidemic compares to other countries
description: Comparing the UK’s epidemic to other countries after Friday saw the biggest rise in deaths so far.

title: Manu Dibango: The saxophone legend who inspired a disco groove
description: Manu Dibango, whose Soul Makossa filled New York dance floors, died this week at the age of 86.

title: Coronavirus: Stranded in another country
description: BBC News speaks to some of the people from the UK who have been stranded abroad due to the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: The woman behind India's first testing kit
description: With the first made-in-India kits, the country could hugely scale up testing for the coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus in Wales: Flood-hit families struggle with virus
description: Flooding triggered by storms caused hundreds of millions of pounds of damage in Wales.

title: Coronavirus: 'It is a worrying time to be running a zoo'
description: Animal attractions face huge outgoings without the visitors who provide their income.

title: Coronavirus: Russia sees no epidemic but starts shutdown
description: Russia begins a "non-working week" to try to slow the spread of coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Will food supply fears see a rise in home-grown veg?
description: "Food insecurity" could cause a wave of first time horticulturalists, experts say.

title: Retired police 'will jump at' return
description: Former officers says many would go back into service to help their forces cope during the pandemic.
